intro: Pleurothyrium chrysothyrsus, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a hard, woody shell. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
